title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 January 2014 - XWiki

08:49 <DarkKnightCZ> is there any best practice for profiling xwiki instance? since startup (16 min), xwiki generated 125k selects/updates/deletes on database... as discussed on friday, it could be solr ("New index directory detected: old=null" on every startup), any ideas?  
08:55 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <mflorea> has quit  
08:58 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <cjd\_> has quit  
09:11 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <Kebir> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <vrachieru> has quit  
09:41 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Hi, can you help me with german umlaute? At first it worked, creating blog headdings with ÖÜÄ, but meanwhile it fails. Can it depend on a blog category i created with ÄÖÜ, which i can not delete? DB: postgres 9.3; Serv. container: tomcat 7; OS: win8 64bit, xwiki 5.3.  
09:55 <evalica1> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: hi - I don't know how to help you, but it might be a good idea to report your issue on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI/component/11210 (you need to have a user on jira.xwiki.org). If you report it a developer will be able to take a look at it and see if it's a regression.  
10:01 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> Thanks for the info.  
10:09 <sburjan> Hello. Can someone tell me if I can use a dependency of an application which is attached as a XAR to a page ?  
10:10 <sburjan> I am reffering to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FullCalendar+Application  
10:10 <sburjan> I need to add this application as a dependency to another app  
10:16 <sburjan> mflorea, tmortagne , any idea ?  
10:18 <tmortagne> sburjan: I don't really understand the question, something attachment to a page is an attachment, nothing else  
10:18 <sburjan> ok, thanks  
10:18 <tmortagne> where and how do you want to use that attachment ?  
10:19 <sburjan> I want to use this app as a dependency for another. Trying to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAMEETINGS-13  
10:19 <mflorea> sburjan: if you need to build the other app with maven then you need th dependency on a maven repo. If you just need to publish the other app on e.x.o, then it's enough to specify the dep on the extension page  
10:19 <sburjan> okay, I go my answer. Thanks mflorea and tmortagne  
10:20 <tmortagne> why did you talked about attachments ?  
10:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <tmortagne> what do you want as dependency exactly ? FullCalendar+Application ?  
10:20 <mflorea> tmortagne: FullCalendar is not released on contrib, you have have the XAR attached to the extension page  
10:20 <mflorea> you can cannot use it as a dep on a maven proiect  
10:21 <tmortagne> I tough sburjan was talking about an attachment in one of the application pages  
10:21 <mflorea> but you can use it as dep for another app that is published on e.x.o (as long as you don't want to build it with maven)  
10:21 <sburjan> well the Meeting Application is build with Maven, so ..  
10:22 <sburjan> thanks for the answers  
10:22 <mflorea> so you need to publish full calendar on contrib  
10:22 <tmortagne> sburjan: Maven can only depends on Maven, it's as simple as that  
10:22 <mflorea> before adding the dep on pom.xml  
10:22 <tmortagne> exo is not a maven repository  
10:22 <sburjan> thanks  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <vmassol> Guys could someone look at hidden doc feature when there's a page with translations, it doesn't seem to work  
10:39 <vmassol> when I seleect hidden doc and save and then edit again it's not checked  
10:39 <vmassol> (I'm in a training today so anyone who could look at this for 5.4 would be great)  
10:39 <vmassol> thanks  
10:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: so when you are in a translation and not on the document default version ? or is it failing in any version as long as there is a translation ?  
10:40 <vrachieru> has quit  
10:40 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm in the default  
10:43 <vmassol> but this page has  1 translation  
10:43 <vmassol> no multilingual  
10:43 <vmassol> actually checking sandbox  
10:44 <vmassol> yep  
10:44 <vmassol> can be reproduced on sandbox  
10:44 <vmassol> (my wiki is in fr)  
10:48 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <tmortagne> ok  
10:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <lucaa> has quit  
10:59 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <evalica1> has quit  
11:10 <polx> has quit  
11:11 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way to easily disable solr? (for testing purposes)  
11:15 <ClemensR> DarkKnightCZ: I have not tried lately, but maybe moving away the webapps/wiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-platform-search-solr-\* jars and restart works  
11:20 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yep, solr is not running now, thanks... and it took "only" 25k of database requests to display main page :)  
11:20 <ClemensR> ok, this is definitely not normal  
11:27 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... i will try to disable one plugin after another to figure out what causes it... if i try to load empty page, it takes only 12 database requests (several session settings and few data selects) and it takes about a second, if i try to load document with an attachment and some text, it takes 80 database requests and ~3 seconds, but if i try to load main page, it takes about 1300 database requests and ~5-10 seconds  
11:31 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: lucene also do the same thing than Solr at startup (when there is not already a lucene index)  
11:32 <tmortagne> it's the ancestor of Solr module basically  
11:32 <tmortagne> we will soon remove it form XE  
11:34 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep, i'm familiar with lucene, but it should be ok (no info messages in log, no large asnych increment of queries), but i will try to disable it too  
11:34 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <DarkKnightCZ> disabling LucenePlugin should do the trick, right?  
11:36 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: yes  
11:43 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <DarkKnightCZ> well, startup still takes 20k requests (selects/updates), but loading normal page takes 200-400 requests  
11:52 <DarkKnightCZ> slowest part is still database (according to cpu sampler), but it's way faster than previously (hibernate now uses mariadb connector + hikari connection pool)

15:13 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a reason why hibernate mapping doesn't contain "cache" element? or is is set in source?  
15:24 <sburjan> has quit  
15:43 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:46 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <msmeria> has quit  
16:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <lucaa1> has quit  
16:35 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
16:46 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
16:46 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <sashyla> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <sashyla> has quit  
16:54 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
16:55 <gdelhumeau> hi devs  
16:55 <gdelhumeau> I have a problem while migrating from 5.2.2 to 5.4-SNAPSHOT  
16:56 <cjd> hi devs.. how distant of you.. You're one of us now hehe ;)  
16:57 <gdelhumeau> when I try to upgrade a subwiki with DW (either with "upgrade all wikis" or direcly by accessing the subwiki), DW is blocked just after clicking on "upgrade" (when XWiki Enterprise - UI - Wiki is proposed)  
16:57 <gdelhumeau> cjd: ;)  
16:57 <gdelhumeau> see: http://tof.canardpc.com/view/11a85304-c1a8-42ea-85c9-a34282935b72.jpg  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> and http://tof.canardpc.com/view/16cb6dbf-29d9-450c-8cef-636f8c8bb80f.jpg  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> and nothong in the logs  
16:59 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I doubt you are up to date, upgrade mode does not exist anymore  
16:59 <tmortagne> so there is no way you get this step with an updated master  
17:00 <tmortagne> unless you are talking about the step with the listed subwikis ?  
17:00 <gdelhumeau> yes I am  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> the "Wikis" step  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> there is no "Upgrade all wikis" anymore, indeed  
17:01 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you are sure another extension action is not started in some other wiki ?  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
17:01 <tmortagne> from what you say it sounds like your upgrade is waiting for another job already running  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> there is no reason  
17:02 <tmortagne> if it's not that then without debugging, no idea  
17:02 <gdelhumeau> ls data/jobs/status/extension/action/  --> org.xwiki.enterprise%3Axwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki  
17:03 <tmortagne> if you can debug all I can suggest is to look at org.xwiki.job.internal.DefaultJobManager and see why your job is not started  
17:03 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <tmortagne> but from JobManager point of view, if the job is not started it's that the previous one is not finished  
17:04 <tmortagne> now what is this previous one...  
17:06 <gdelhumeau> I have an empty data/jobs/status/extension/action/org.xwiki.enterprise%3Axwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki/wiki%3Axwiki/status.xml file  
17:12 <tmortagne> sounds like infinite loop in XStream when saving job status, but that would be at the very beginning if you really have nothing at all  
17:13 <tmortagne> if you can debug it you should probably look at what thread is running and pause it to see what it's doing  
17:13 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau:  
17:14 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking  
17:16 <gdelhumeau> http://hastebin.com/yokonudago.rb  
17:17 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
17:17 <tmortagne> according to the dump it's currently saving serializing the status  
17:17 <gdelhumeau> for too long, then  
17:18 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <tmortagne> I doubt it's a speed issue, IMO some serialized data is causing an infinite loop in XStream  
17:18 <tmortagne> but hard to know what and why without debugging it in step by step  
17:20 <tmortagne> and it would be an infinite loop with is not caused by a recursion since that would have failed quickly (a lot quicker at least)  
17:20 <tmortagne> s/with/which/  
17:20 <gdelhumeau> yep  
17:22 <tmortagne> I guess the best is to connect you EDI to your instance and pause the thread to see what it's trying to serialize exactly  
17:22 <gdelhumeau> I'm trying to pause it  
17:23 <vrachieru> has quit  
17:23 <gdelhumeau> JobStatusSerializer.java line 91  
17:24 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you need to debug XStream itself  
17:24 <tmortagne> that like is just the one that start XStream  
17:25 <evalica> has quit  
17:25 <tmortagne> it's not stuck in that class but a lot lower in XStream  
17:27 <tmortagne> your EDI should lead you to what is currently executed when you pause it and it's not that line  
17:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:28 <tmortagne> it should be around com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeMarshaller.convertAnother(TreeMarshaller.java:43)  
17:28 <tmortagne> with is the current line in your thread dump  
17:30 <tmortagne> s/with/which/  
17:32 <gdelhumeau> public void convertAnother(Object item) {  
17:32 <gdelhumeau>         convertAnother(item, null);  
17:33 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: sure but that's what the dump say already :)  
17:33 <tmortagne> it's not indicating what is the issue  
17:33 <gdelhumeau> yes  
17:34 <tmortagne> look at the type of the item  
17:34 <tmortagne> and see if it's the same one again when next time you enter in this method for example  
17:35 <Kebir> has quit  
17:35 <gdelhumeau> the item is always different  
17:35 <tmortagne> maybe not always, I guess it does a few objects and then again the same objects  
17:36 <evalica> has quit  
17:38 <gdelhumeau> there is a loop indeed  
17:38 <tmortagne> what is the root object ? an exception ?  
17:38 <gdelhumeau> one of the element is <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><versionCheck><groupIdPrefix>org.xwiki.commons</groupIdPrefix><allowedVersionRegex>\$\{commons.version\}|[^$].\*</allowedVersionRegex></versionCheck>  
17:39 <tmortagne> what is the type of this object ?  
17:39 <gdelhumeau> it seems it is a Xpp3Dom  
17:39 <tmortagne> looks like a Maven model  
17:40 <tmortagne> can you see in the stack what contains this object ?  
17:40 <tmortagne> I find pretty weird to end up with something like this in the log  
17:40 <gdelhumeau> parent: http://hastebin.com/laveyopeja.xml  
17:41 <Kebir> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <tmortagne> this is still Maven stuff, could go go back a lot more to see where those Maven stuff come from  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> <configuration> is the root parent  
17:43 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: the root parent is the job status, that's what is being serialized  
17:44 <tmortagne> so you should be able to go back a lot higher that this <configuration> thing  
17:47 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: I seems to be able to reproduce it with jetty/hsqldb, need to restart in debug mode  
17:48 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: when I am in <configuration> , parent is null  
17:48 <tmortagne> I don't know what you call parent  
17:48 <gdelhumeau> it is a field of  Xpp3Dom  
17:49 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's not what you should look at  
17:49 <tmortagne> go back in the thread stack  
17:49 <tmortagne> and you should see objects that contains this Xpp3Dom  
17:50 <tmortagne> as you said parent is just a field of Xpp3Dom that happen to be named "parent", there is no reason this is where it come from  
17:50 <gdelhumeau> ok, then the parent is DefaultJobStatus  
17:51 <tmortagne> of course, that's the root object but I'm more interrested in the last XWiki object that contains this Xpp3Dom  
17:51 <gdelhumeau> I'm fighting with the EDI  
17:52 <tmortagne> anyway I'm trying to access the same thing  
17:58 <pristavala> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <tmortagne> I found the log that have a parameter way more complex than it should and end up with the Maven object, but not sure why there is an infinite loop  
18:07 <vmassol> back  
18:07 <vmassol> anyone has been able to reproduce my issue of this morning?  
18:07 <vmassol> I've found another bug in the meantime during the training. I'll report both tomorrow but they seem to be quite blocker  
18:09 <pristavala> has quit  
18:13 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's not fixing the serializing of Maven object but the Maven object should not end up in the log anymore so it should be ok now  
18:13 <gdelhumeau> ok thx  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> I propose to merge https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/compare/feature-wiki-members in master  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> Members of subwikis are stored in XWikiMemberGroup  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> And there is a migrator that put create this group  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> & change the rights  
18:17 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: the only change the migrator does to XWikiAllGroup is removing main wiki members, right ? it does not touch its rights ?  
18:21 <gdelhumeau> all rights set to XWIkiAllGroup are now set to XWikiMemberGroup  
18:21 <gdelhumeau> but XWikiAllGroup is a member of XWikiMemberGroup  
18:21 <tmortagne> so you remove the right that used to be set to XWIkiAllGroup ?  
18:21 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/feature-wiki-members/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki/xwiki-platform-wiki-user/xwiki-platform-wiki-user-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/wiki/user/internal/membermigration/DefaultMemberRightsMigrator.java  
18:22 <cjd> has quit  
18:22 <gdelhumeau> no, I update them  
18:23 <tmortagne> I don't understand what you mean, does the group XWIkiAllGroup have the same direct right associated to it ot not ? And I'm talking about direct right, not right coming from being a member of XWikiMemberGroup  
18:24 <gdelhumeau> it does not  
18:24 <tmortagne> IMO this is not right  
18:26 <gdelhumeau> has left #xwiki  
18:26 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
18:26 <gdelhumeau> IMO it's more simple for the user to only take care of the XWikiMemberGroup permissions  
18:26 <gdelhumeau> instead of having these rights for members AND  local users  
18:27 <vmassol> has quit  
18:28 <tmortagne> when he knows this group exist, in many subwikis there is only local users and admin configured rights for them, then after migrating they will suddenly loose all the rights associated to XWikiAllGroup when looking at the right UI  
18:28 <tmortagne> I'm sure we'll get some WTF
